# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ§Šâ”‚3d-design

## 1. Summary:
The discussion centers around a technical limitation in Hyperfy where large 3D models are being clipped by the skybox. Mugenomics encountered this issue while working with a massive 1600m-long spaceship model, where portions beyond approximately 1000m were disappearing. Community members identified that the skybox in Hyperfy is a sphere with a 1km radius that moves with the player, causing anything beyond that distance to be clipped. Temporary workarounds suggested included using fog effects to mask the clipping. Ashxn provided technical clarification about the skybox implementation and mentioned future plans to make the sky customizable as an app.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Is there any way to increase the draw distance? (asked by Mugenomics) A: The skybox is a sphere with 1km radius that moves with the player, causing clipping beyond that distance. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Could the skybox be clipping large models? (asked by Mugenomics) A: Yes, the sky is a sphere with 1km radius. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there a way to scale up the skybox geometry with a hyp script? (asked by Mugenomics) A: Unanswered, but Ashxn mentioned plans to make the sky an app for customization.
